term.longtitle: IUPAC Gold Book - impregnation in polymer chemistry
term.title: impregnation

item.text: Penetration of monomeric, oligomeric, or polymeric liquids into an assembly of fibres.

notes.item: The term as defined here is specific to polymer science. An alternative definition of 'impregnation' applies in some other fields of chemistry.
Impregnation is usually carried out on a woven fabric or a yarn.

sources.item: PAC, 2004, 76, 1985. 'Definition of terms related to polymer blends, composites, and multiphase polymeric materials (IUPAC Recommendations 2004)' on page 1991 (https://doi.org/10.1351/pac200476111985)

term.disclaimer: The International Union of Pure and Applied Chemistry (IUPAC) is continuously reviewing and, where needed, updating terms in the Compendium of Chemical Terminology (the IUPAC Gold Book). Users of these terms are encouraged to include the version of a term with its use and to check regularly for updates to term definitions that you are using.
